item.description:
@makr28 wrote:

Can someone please help me delete the allocated memory using the following code
I know you use delete [] but i’m not sure how to write it so it works. thanks for any help you can give me

void allocMem(Player pl[], char size)
{
short numOfR = (toupper(size) == ‘L’) ? LARGER : SMALLR;
short numOfC = (toupper(size) == ‘L’) ? LARGEC : SMALLC;

try
{
for(short i = 0; i < NUMPL; ++i)
{
pl[i].m_gGrid[0] = NULL;
pl[i].m_gGrid[0] = new Ship*[numOfR];
pl[i].m_gGrid[1] = NULL;
pl[i].m_gGrid[1] = new Ship*[numOfR];
for(short j = 0; j < numOfR; ++j)
{
pl[i].m_gGrid[0][j] = NULL;
pl[i].m_gGrid[0][j] = new Ship[numOfC];
pl[i].m_gGrid[1][j] = NULL;
pl[i].m_gGrid[1][j] = new Ship[numOfC];

//---------------------------------…
for(short k = 0; k < numOfC; ++k)
{
pl[i].m_gGrid[0][j][k] = SHIP;
pl[i].m_gGrid[1][j][k] = SHIP;
} // end for k
} // end for j
} // end for i
}
catch(exception e)
{
deleteMem(pl, size);
cerr << "exception: " << e.what() << endl;
cout << “shutting down” << endl;
cin.ignore(BUFFER_SIZE, ‘\n’);
exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
}
}
